numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that the youth group has more buoyancy than the elder group.
2. Most first-world countries are in the 50% column.
3. Many third-world countries are in the top portion of the graph.
4. The top portion of the graph can show a better value for life.
5. I wonder why there are more youths than elders.
6. I wonder why elders do not think that the world is getting better.
7. I wonder where the data for elders comes from.
8. It seems that there is data for only 3 countries for elders.
9. I wonder why there is not more data for elders.
10. This could be the only explanation for why more youths seem optimistic.
11. This relates to me a lot.
12. I am part of a new and upcoming generation.
13. What we do dictates the future of the world.
14. Less elders may believe in the betterment of the world.
15. If less elders believe in the betterment of the world then we must find out what to do for the betterment of our future.
16. The headline is: Differences in generations and the future.
